info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Saratoga County through 245 PM EDT... At 219 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Fort Edward, or 9 miles northeast of Saratoga Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Saratoga Springs, Gates, Wilton, Northumberland, Schuylerville, Victory, Gurn Spring, Bacon Hill, Jewell Corner, Hickeys Corners, Grangerville, Kings Station, Gansevoort, Cedar Bluffs, Starks Knob, Ballard Corners, Burgoyne, Dimmick Corners, Fortsville and Barnes Corners. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 14 and 17N. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
